title: Two women killed in Southern Expressway crash
byline: Two women were killed and four others injured when a van overturned following a tyre burst on the Southern Expressway, police said.

title: At least 38 killed in church attack in eastern DR Congo
byline: At least 38 people have been killed and 15 others injured in an attack on a church in the eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC).

title: Government to launch globally-recognised module system in schools from 2026
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) government will introduce a module-based education system starting in 2026, initially focusing on Grades 1 and 6.

title: Businesswoman Thilini Priyamali  arrested
byline: Businesswoman Thilini Priyamali has been arrested by the Homagama Police for allegedly obstructing the duties of an official at the Homagama Magistrate’s Court.

title: Bathiya was dead before Indian veterinary experts
byline: Elphant Bathiya was who suffering from gunshot injuries was dead before the Indian veterinary experts could treat him, Deputy Minister of Environment and Wildlife Anton Jayakody said yesterday.

title: Doctors demand clarity as confusion grows
byline: Doctors across the country remain deeply confused and uncertain over the Health Ministry’s new circular that outlines how state hospitals should allow patients to buy medical drugs and surgical items from outside suppliers.

title: One dead, several injured following accident in Borella
byline: One person was killed and more than five others were injured in a road accident near the Borella Cemetery Roundabout this morning, police said.

title: EU and US agree trade deal, with 15% tariffs for European exports to America
byline: The United States and European Union have reached a trade deal framework, ending a months-long standoff between two of the world’s biggest economic partners.

title: Hong Kong turn to ex-Sri Lanka Test player Kaushal Silva
byline: Former Sri Lanka wicketkeeper batsman Kaushal Silva has been appointed as the new head coach of Hong Kong’s cricket team, the sport’s governing body in the city said on Monday.

title: President leaves for Maldives
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake departed from the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) this morning (28) for a three-day official visit to the Maldives.

title: U.S. dispatches crude oil samples , but won’t reach Sri Lanka before August 1
byline: In its bid to start fuel sale to Sri Lanka as part of efforts to reduce the trade gap, the U.S. has dispatched samples of its crude oil to be tested for viability here,an official said.

title: Foreign investors do not have to pay bribes, commissions in SL anymore : Govt.
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Vijitha Herath yesterday said that the government was free of corruption, and it was now a good time for foreign investors to invest in Sri Lanka.

title: Locomotive operating engineers to launch 48-hour strike from tomorrow
byline: The Locomotive Operating Engineers’ Union (LOEU) has announced a 48-hour islandwide token strike starting tomorrow (29), over unresolved issues related to signal system malfunctions and delays in grade-based promotions.

title: Alleged forgery: Seethawaka District Secretariat official released on bail
byline: Don Ruwini Wasana, the former Additional District Registrar of the Seethawak District Secretariat was released on bail in connection with preparing a forged birth certificate to facilitate the issuing of a passport for an organised criminal figure known as ’Kehelbaddara Padme’.

title: P.A.G. Fernando appointed chief secretary of Uva Province
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has appointed Mrs. P.A.G. Fernando as the new Chief Secretary of the Uva Province with immediate effect.

title: GovPay online fine payment launched today in Western Province, expressways
byline: The GovPay online payment system for traffic fines was officially launched today (28) in the Western Province and on expressways, Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation Minister Bimal Ratnayake said.

title: Education reform is not just about introducing new textbooks: Minister
byline: The government’s education reform is not just about introducing a new textbook, but about completely overhauling the current system to reduce pressure on the students, parents and teachers, Prime Minister and Education Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya said.

title: Head monk of Shaolin ’Kung Fu’ temple faces criminal probe
byline: Shi Yongxin, the abbot of the world-renowned Shaolin Temple, is being investigated by multiple agencies for embezzlement, ’’improper relationships with multiple women’’ and ’’fathering illegitimate children’’, the temple said on Sunday.

title: No shortage of essential medical items: Ministry of Health officials
byline: The Ministry of Health officials informed the Sectoral Oversight Committee on Health, Media and Women’s Empowerment that there is no shortage of essential medical items at present.

title: Allow only bottled coconut oil, Consumer group tells Coconut Development Board
byline: The National Movement for Consumer Rights Protection (NCMRP) requested the Chairman of the Coconut Development Board (CDB) to allow only bottled and labeled coconut oil to be sold in the market, in order to prevent the ongoing racket of selling adulterated coconut oil, which is harmful to health.

title: Thailand and Cambodia agree to ceasefire - Malaysia PM
byline: The leaders of Thailand and Cambodia have agreed to an immediate and unconditional ceasefire to end their border clashes, Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said on Monday, following talks in Malaysia between the two Southeast Asian neighbours.

title: Arrest warrant issued on Namal Rajapaksa
byline: An arrest warrant was issued by the Hambantota Magistrate’s Court against Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna MP Namal Rajapaksa today.

title: Crane driver suspected to be high on cannabis causes fatal crash in Borella
byline: The crane driver arrested this morning following the accident near the Kanatta roundabout in Borella, which left one person dead and seven others injured, is suspected to have been under the influence of cannabis at the time of the incident.

title: President, Namal airborne together
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake and Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) National Organiser Namal Rajapaksa happened to be on board the same flight to the Maldives today.

title: Borella accident: Victims’ conditions to be announced by evening
byline: The condition of seven individuals injured in a road accident near the Borella Cemetery Roundabout will be officially announced by this evening, Colombo National Hospital (CNH) Deputy Director Dr. Rukshan Bellana said

title: Acting ministers appointed
byline: In light of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake’s departure for a state visit to the Maldives, four acting ministers have been appointed to oversee key ministries.

title: Hold Provincial Council elections immediately: PAFFREL to Govt.
byline: The People’s Action for Free and Fair Elections (PAFFREL) has urged the government to hold long-overdue Provincial Council elections without further delay.

title: National minimum wage increased to Rs. 27,000 from April 1
byline: While issuing a notice, the Labour Department announced an increase in the national minimum wage, effective April 1, 2025.

title: Security officer falls from building in Jaffna
byline: A security officer attached to the Agricultural Faculty in the Jaffna University fell to death from the upper story of a building last night (27), Police said.

title: Bathiya dead before Indian veterinary experts arrived
byline: Elphant Bathiya was who suffering from gunshot injuries was dead before the Indian veterinary experts could treat him, Deputy Minister of Environment and Wildlife Anton Jayakody said yesterday.

title: Retired MPs collective contemplating legal action against slashing of pensions
byline: Retired MPs Collective is contemplating legal action if MPs pension is abolished, its secretary Premasiri Manage said.

title: Parliamentary Committee to consult experts on education reforms
byline: Whilst an extensive public debate is being carried out on the government’s education reforms, the Sectoral Oversight Committee on education has decided to seek the assistance of experts who have been involved in compiling education reforms in the past.

title: Giant manta ray weighing over 500 kilograms caught in Mannar
byline: A giant manta ray (locally known as kombu thirukkai) weighing over 500 kilograms was caught today in the coastal waters of Mannar’s Mutharipputhurai area.

title: Rugby swings back into caretaker hands
byline: In yet another move the administration of rugby was passed back into the hands of the stop gap Working Task Force (WTF) this time following objections raised by the Attorney General’s Department over the granting of a court Stay Order sought by the Western Province Rugby Football Union (WPRFU).

title: Rs. 43Mn financial fraud: Court summons Colombo business couple
byline: Colombo Fort Magistrate Nilupuli Lankapura issued notice to businessman Narej Parasuram Bhoomani and businesswoman Meena Bhoomani, instructing them to appear before court on August 20 in connection with a cheque fraud case involving over Rs. 43 million.

title: Two nabbed with 47kg of spotted deer meat from Yala National Park
byline: Two individuals were arrested yesterday while transporting 47 kilograms of spotted deer meat on two motorcycles from Yala National Park, the Wildlife Department said.

title: Two agreements signed between Sri Lanka, Maldives
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, currently on a state visit to the Maldives, held bilateral discussions with Maldivian President Dr. Mohamed Muizzu this afternoon at the Maldivian Presidential Office.

title: Attorney with 37 years’ experience disbarred for fraudulent land deal
byline: The Supreme Court has found an attorney with over 37 years of legal practice guilty of deceit and struck him off the roll of Attorneys-at-Law for misconduct and malpractice. He was also permanently barred from engaging in notarial practice.

title: Red warrant obtained against Royal Park convict: AG
byline: The Attorney General informed the Supreme Court yesterday that authorities have obtained a red warrant for the arrest of Jude Shamantha Jayamaha, who was sentenced to death in connection with the Royal Park murder case.

title: Former Navy Commander Ulugetenne remanded
byline: Former Navy Commander Admiral (Rtd) Nishantha Ulugetenne was remanded till July 30 by the Polgahawela Magistrate’s Court.

title: CSE records modest gains
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) began the week on a positive footing, with the All Share Price Index (ASPI) climbing nearly 122 points in early trading. While the market experienced a slight loss in momentum as the session progressed, it managed to close with a gain of 50.15 points (+0.26%) at 19,517.86.

title: Immigration nabs three Bangladeshi nationals with fake Sri Lankan passports at BIA
byline: Three Bangladeshi nationals bound for Tehran, Iran were arrested by the Department of Immigration and Emigration (DIE) officials at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) this evening for having forged Sri Lankan passports in their possession.

title: Male leopard found dead in Katukitula
byline: An adult male leopard was found dead in Katukitula area in the Kothmale in what is suspected to be yet another tragic incident involving the illegal use of ’Hakka Patas’—a deadly trap commonly used to kill wild animals.

title: Thilini Priyamali released on bail
byline: Businesswoman Thilini Priyamali, who was arrested by the Homagama Police for allegedly obstructing the duties of an official at the Homagama Magistrate’s Court, has been released on bail.

title: Broker arrested for bribery near Motor Traffic Department
byline: A broker was arrested today by the Bribery Commission while accepting a bribe near the Department of Motor Traffic in Narahenpita.

title: Man caught killing and skinning protected fishing cat
byline: A man has been arrested for killing and skinning a fishing cat which is an animal classified as highly protected within the Karawilagala area of the Pallekele Sanctuary in Kahalla, authorities said.

title: Former Navy Commander Nishantha Ulugetenne arrested
byline: Former Navy Commander Nishantha Ulugetenne has been arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) in connection with an investigation into a kidnapping incident in the Pothuhera area.

title: Rs. 50 million worth foreign cigarettes seized at BIA cargo village
byline: A stock of foreign-manufactured cigarettes worth Rs. 50 million was seized by the Central Intelligence Unit of the Sri Lanka Customs today at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) Cargo Village.
